title: Open Coffee Lisbon #46 - New venue
description: We have a new venue. Folklore Cafe, led by Wolfie and Fatema, We had our Christmas party there, and were made to feel very welcome. These videos show the two routes from the street level to the venue. https://www.youtube.com/shorts/hpPwrXcwNpU https://www.youtube.com/shorts/l18Q649nl7Q Open Coffee Lisbon is a friendly informal networking event for entrepreneurs, professionals, locals, guests, people in the startup community, and students in Lisbon.‚Å£ Your host for our event will be [Richard Lucas ](www.linkedin.com/in/richardhlucas/)with support [Jason](https://www.linkedin.com/in/anirvan-jason-gomes-33524024b/) from the Open Coffee Lisbon team You may find a mentor, investor, client, co founder, employer, vendor, inspiration or a friend. Please post your contact details, a link to your Linkedin and/webpage in this group chat, and in our WhatsApp group [here ](https://chat.whatsapp.com/HZNea7wHN0093bOylglaKY)https://chat.whatsapp.com/HZNea7wHN0093bOylglaKY We start at 09:30 AM sharp. Everybody gets up to 2 minutes to present: 1. Who they are and what they are doing 2. What they want 3. How they can help others At 10:30 AM we stop hosting and you can talk to people who are most interesting to you. We are focused on business and social entrepreneurs, the startup community and anyone else who is doing something interesting or wants to get involved in other people's projects. You can talk about any project/topic. Open Coffee Lisbon is an ‚Äúun-meeting‚Äù without a speaker or agenda. We are focused on attendees gaining value from other attendees. The rules, tools, structure and moderation aim to facilitate this goal. ‚Å£‚Å£What is the BIG idea behind Open Coffee? We want to help people create useful business connections.‚Å£ Everyone is welcome to our meetings, and we especially love first-timers.‚Å£ ‚Å£We want to make sure that if somebody coming from an unsupportive background/country has the courage to join, they will notice that we are glad they came because we welcome them. If you feel shy, you can also just listen but we encourage you to talk. Each attendee can also get to show their LinkedIn page or website through our channels and showcase their idea.‚Å£ This event is based on the Open Coffee Krakow format, run by Richard Lucas and others in Krakow Poland since 2012. If you want to help and get involved in making this gathering a regular part of the Lisbon eco-system please let us know [here](https://forms.gle/hjQUMyFap5K8yo8y9) https://forms.gle/hjQUMyFap5K8yo8y9 if you are interested in knowing more about the Open Coffee format, take a look at our video for potential leaders [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z99E2z8anFU). We have events in Cambridge, Krakow, Ericeira, Sydney, Warsaw and soon Tirana according to our format, When you sign up to our events we add you to our [mailing list](https://lisboncommunityevents.substack.com/) https://lisboncommunityevents.substack.com so we can tell you about more free events run by volunteers . If you don't want us to do that don't give us your email. If you change your mind you can leave the Substack mailing list at any time.

title: Open Coffee Lisbon Evening Social
description: Join us for the **Open Coffee Lisbon Evening Social**‚Äîa relaxed, welcoming gathering designed for anyone in Lisbon‚Äôs vibrant startup and professional community who wants to connect beyond the usual business talk. Hosted by Richard Lucas and the friendly Open Coffee Lisbon team, this event is all about genuine conversations, new friendships, and building a supportive network in a laid-back atmosphere. Many of our current event participants head out for lunch to hang out after our sell out morning meetings. We decided to offer a more social event in fabulous setting. Whether you‚Äôre an entrepreneur, student, creative, tourist, or simply curious, you‚Äôll find a space where everyone is encouraged to mingle, share stories, and discover common interests. Our events are open and welcoming to people from all backgrounds and ages. Many different nationalities come together at our events, as well as long term Lisbon residents. Our motto "we welcome all, who welcome all." **This is not a speed dating/pickup type event. Everyone who attends is entitled to feel safe, not be harassed or pressured.** **EVENT STRUCTURE:** We will have a structured first sixty minutes with icebreakers aimed at making things easy for people to connect with one another. Then participants are welcome to hang out and socialise as they wish after the structured part of the meeting is over. **REACH OUT:** If you have a community initiative you want to share or announce, let us know in advance. **VOLUNTEERS** We need volunteers to help us develop the project. From simple things like being early to welcome people, through to PR and graphic design and a website. Let us know if that sounds like you and apply to join the team [here](https://forms.gle/EeLboZcYBrLesVt26) Newcomers are especially welcome, and if you‚Äôre feeling shy, don't worry. you‚Äôre free to listen or join in at your own pace. Bring your ideas, your curiosity, and your favourite conversation starters. Share your LinkedIn or project links with the group, and let‚Äôs help each other grow‚Äîpersonally and professionally. This evening is about making connections that matter, all in a friendly, inclusive setting. If you‚Äôd like to help shape future gatherings or feature in our community newsletter, let us know. Come for the connections, stay for the camaraderie! Please let us know if you can volunteer and help [here](https://forms.gle/EeLboZcYBrLesVt26) **Please note that the evening entrance is from the sea front. Use [this link](https://maps.app.goo.gl/4aNCJLp9JXRqCsUC6) to find your way from the Metro.** if you are at the "City" side entrance of Titanic [here](https://maps.app.goo.gl/tEb6MmBNxoaBZhcHA) , and can't figure out how to get in, check [this video ](https://youtube.com/shorts/gq0QQ_RnNbQ?si=rKthOudD36TIS5GB)It's only 8 seconds long. The correct pin for the entrance is [here](https://maps.app.goo.gl/Zjkfu5hVCeEV5miH8)
